item.title: Alex add a quote by Ryu Murakami
item.description: "People who love horror films are people with boring lives... when a really scary movie is over, you're reassured to see that you're still alive and the world still exists as it did before. That's the real reason we have horror films - they act as shock absorbers - and if they disappeared altogether, I bet you'd see a big leap in the number of serial killers. After all, anyone stupid enough to get the idea of murdering people from a movie could get the same idea from watching the news." -- Ryu Murakami

item.title: Alex add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "In the very depths of Hell, do not demons love one another?" -- Anne Rice
